# Lake County Tech Meetup

## 🚀 Quick start

### Requirements

* node.js - v12.13.0 (LTS)
* yarn (see [installation options](https://yarnpkg.com/lang/en/docs/install/))


### Initial Setup

Clone the repository, navigate into your new site’s directory and start it up.

```sh
git clone git@github.com:lake-county-tech-meetup/website.git lctm-website
cd lctm-website/
yarn install
```

### Open the source code and start editing

_Note: You'll also see a second link: _`http://localhost:8000/___graphql`_. This is a tool you can use to experiment with querying your data. Learn more about using this tool in the [Gatsby tutorial](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/tutorial/part-five/#introducing-graphiql)._

Open the `lctm-website` directory in your code editor of choice.

### Running locally

```sh
yarn start
```

Your site is now running at `http://localhost:8000`.

### Building

```sh
yarn build
```

### Configuration

See [config/siteConfig.js](config/siteConfig.js)

### Linting/Style

We use Eslint & Prettier. See [our ESLint config](.eslintrc) & [our prettier config](.prettierrc)

```sh
yarn lint
```

or to auto-fix

```sh
yarn lint --fix
```

### Testing

```sh
yarn test
```
